text: Ebell of Long Beach was a women's club in Long Beach, California. It was one of the largest women's clubs in Southern California, and was organized November 16, 1896, with seventeen charter members. It was a chapter of the Ebell Society. In the 1920s it had well over one thousand member and twenty departments. Pearl Jane Pearson Brison was an organizer and served as a president. ==References== Category:Long Beach, California Category:Women's clubs in the United States
title: Ebell of Long Beach
